p: The main consensus emerging from diverse studies to date is that the formation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and/or reactive nitrogen species (RNS) is the main feature of CP that contributes to virus inactivation, whereas UV irradiation and temperature changes are only minor contributors or have no effect. Different methods have been used to measure and identify the RONS ( Table 1 ), but this is a challenging task because of their short lifespan.
